text:
°•° List of sexist remarks I have encountered in the past month:

1. "Women's identity is from her husband. I don't do house chores because this is Pakistan not Europe." (Coming that from a guy who is raised by a single mother says a lot about how internalized this concept is within the minds of Pakistani people with or without men setting such precedents.) 2. "I hate it when women play the card of 'don't tell me what to do' because, if you don't obey me, I am obviously going to get angry and scold you." 3. "Men should 'sacrifice' their right to dowry so that the show off culture in the society diminishes, the culture whose leaders are women." 4. "Atleast, I don't have to put tons of makeup to look pretty." 5. "My brother is additional secretary who has a higher status than your father and he still likes that his wife cooks him food. That is what our religious, social and cultural values are." 6. "Feminist hou per limits main reh kar. Aurat march type na bano." All this is besides the general disparaging comments that I received from them on my looks during a very normal discussion from these unrelatedly related men. Why is it so hard for men to accept that sometimes there is no right and wrong and just a difference of opinion? They can stoop to any level in order to boast their little egos. All for what? I tell you. The shortcomings in their broughtup and their lack of understanding on how to handle a different pov without being derogatory about it.

Call me rebellious or insolent, but I have found the malady in all this. Guess what, it is not feminism or having a voice to convey my stance. It is your rigidity and ugly inneundo.Rest you can figure on your own what triggers you. (Hint: one of the two small things you possess.) I can stoop to their level too but my arguments are NEVER based on personal remarks about uncontrollable factors unless attacked or provoked otherwise. I will continue to hit men where it hurts them the most. I am not a man hater but I am unapologetically vocal about the fact that I don't respect such species. Never have. Never will. 
Rant over!

P.S I am so proud of people who are breaking the cycle induced with cultural mayhem.

text:
Fuckface Von Clownstick tweeted a bogus map with “Try to impeach this” scrawled across it. This is a good opportunity to remind everyone that in the 2016 presidential election Hillary Clinton received 65,853,514 votes while Mein Pümpkinführer received 62,984,828 votes. That’s 48.2% for HRC and 46.1% for DJT.
-
FACT: Trump received 2,868,686 *fewer* votes than Clinton. This is NOT a mandate by any standard. 
Couple this with polls showing that barely 37% of Americans support Trump (to what degree is unknown) and 60% or more supporting an impeachment inquiry, and it’s clear that Trump is trying very hard to distract us with a lie.
-
Trump would be best served by putting down the cell phone and ceasing all public comment, but he won’t because he can’t. He’s an addict and attention is his meth.
-

text:
Recently i did a Q/A and someone asked me that why do i always look so angry and serious. He said that "larkiyon ko har waqt smile karni chahiye". I wanted to answer that but putting up a story about it wasn't going to cover it all.
.
So here it goes.
What fuels my anger is how you treat your women. I'm angry that the number of rapes in "Islamic" countries keep going up. I'm angry because eveyone thinks Islam oppresses women because of misogynist people. I'm angry because some "scholars" claim that marital rape does not exist. I'm angry at the fact that you say Islam empowers women when you are the who are forcing them into marriages and forcing them to leave their studies and stay in houses. I am angry at how you forbid the mosque for women when the Holy Prophet (pbuh) said "Do not stop Allah's female followers from going into Allah's mosque". I'm angry because you don't let women go to college/universities when the first university in the world was created by a Muslim women, Fatima Al Fihriyya. Or when you refuse your women to work when the first wife of Prophet (pbuh) was a business woman. I'm angry that you throw acid on a women's face if she refuses your proposal. I'm angry at how you blame rape on the victim saying she wasn't covering herself. Does that mean I'm allowed to smash your head in with a hammer because you were not wearing a helmet? I'm angry how you murder your sister,wife,cousin for petty reasons and then have the audacity to call it "honor killing".I'm angry because you think that you have some sort of claim on a women's life. I'm angry because your negative comments can drive young girls and boys to engage in unhealthy behaviors in order to change their body type to conform to the norms of society . I'm angry because you make me feel like I'm nothing. And most of all I'm angry at how powerless I'm to stop all of this. .
Take responsibility for your actions. Certainly Allah is the most just.
.
.
.
.
.
.

It's incredibly irritating how they can rationalize and dismiss the most fucked up parts of the bible like its nothing. You should look up the account "the transformed wife". I could barely make it that far because the religious internalized misogyny was too strong.

text: Anyone who knows me know I am NOT a fan of our current President. Unless you’re living under a rock without WiFi you are fully aware impeachment investigation has begun. I would love nothing more than to have him the hell out of office.  Though, I am concerned that the announcement of impeachment came before the transcript released and before the whistleblower’s complaint was received... fingers crossed. IF Trump withheld military funding to Ukraine in order to elicit dirt on Biden, then he should be impeached! If not this will bog down our political machine and could have possibly devastating effects on our country and the next presidential race. #nixon #onhisowndsdmission #nointegrity #corruptpresident #inherentlydangerous #racist #misogynist #narcissist

text:
I just watched Kabir Singh and I must say, I'm IMPRESSED.

I mean, writing a female character so meek, submissive and unambitious deserves an oscar in itself. The main character, Preeti, played by the fair skinned, gentle looking #kiaraadvani , seemed to be on a mute session for the first 40 minutes of this movie. The guy, Kabir Singh, played by #shahidkapoor , can kiss her on the cheek on their first meetings, and she wont resist or react. With an elevated level of submission in every scene, she would surrender and do whatever she is ordered to do. So much so that the guy would slap her hard across the face, and she would consider it as a form of love.

I mean, wow
I'm impressed 
The character of Kabir Singh is vile to another level. Glorifying self destruction for not having things happen his way, the main protagonist drowns in alcohol, and girls find it HAAWTTT.

He would name his FEMALE DOG PREETY, and people would still rave about his undying love for his BANDI.

Such cringe, much woah 
Surely not watching another Bollywood movie for a very long period of time.

#KabirSingh #shahidkapoor #kiaraadvani #shahidkapur #kabirsinghmovie #movietime #bollywood #review #moviereview #misogyny #misogynist

text: This guy added me on Facebook yesterday. We had a lot of mutual friends so I accepted the request. This morning he went to work harassing me. He went through every single one and posted how I’m an idiot, I’m a liar, how I need to read more, how I need to learn about my own heritage before saying my beliefs and opinions, and other misogynist, hate fueled comments. This guy is a troll that deserves to live under a bridge. After all of that, I saw he sent me a message asking about how I was stabbed. Steve Laney is his name. text:
AfroFuture Fest revoked its race-based pricing after charging white customers $20 and people of color $10. “Our ticket structure was built to insure [sic] that the most marginalized communities (people of color) are provided with an equitable chance at enjoying events in their own community (black Detroit)," read the Eventbrite listing. The payment structure received mixed reactions, with some calling it racial segregation, but others praising the move. Organizers ultimately abandoned the pricing scheme after what they said were violent threats.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
What do you make of this? Right or wrong? Or just plain racist? Voice your opinions below! 👇 #debates2u #Repost @buzzfeednews

text:
Et si aujourd’hui nous parlions des hommes ? 
Pas des hommes qui battent leurs compagnes ou ex compagnes, pas de ceux qui insultent, pas les misogynes ou les machos.

Et si on parlait des autres ? 
Ceux qui comme nous tous ont des torts et font des erreurs, mais qui dans le fond ne sont pas des abrutis finis. 
Ceux qui se sentent démunis face aux #metoo ou #balancetonporc, et qui n'osent plus regarder dans les yeux une femme qu'ils respectent de peur que ce soit mal interprété. 
Ceux qui n'ont pas le droit de pleurer ou d'être faible. 
Ceux à qui personne n'enseigne la cuisine et la couture. 
Ceux qui doivent être forts, musclés, sans peur et sans remords. 
Ceux qu'on veut virils, ambitieux et protecteurs. 
Ceux qu'on imagine pas baisser les bras et ceux dont on a que faire de la gentillesse. 
Et si une part des victimes de ce patriarcat et de son héritage serait aussi les hommes ?

Nous souffrons tous de cette situation, à différentes échelles selon notre position (et le but n'est pas de gagner le combat de qui souffre le plus, ça ne mène jamais à rien). Tou.te.s touché.e.s et tou.te.s acteurs/actrices.

Agissons pour un futur où les femmes ET LES HOMMES ne seront plus soumis à la peur et au jugement.

N’hésitez pas à mentionner ces hommes là... .
Par S🕊.
@lesbadasss.
.
.
.

..
This #WageDisparity is nothing more than #discrimination against women and mothers in the workforce - and proof of America's enduring #misogynist culture.
.
Ending this illegal, #deplorable practice would cut the poverty rate for women in half and boost our national economy.
.
Making this #inequality even worse, instead of helping our nation move forward to close the gender wage gap, the rampantly #antiworker and #antiwomen #TrumpAdministration put an indefinite hold on an important Equal Opportunity Employment Commission (EEOC) pay data collection initiative which was started by the #RealActualPresident Obama.
.
We need to COMPEL our rich, white, male legislators (and their apologist female counterparts) to take a multi-faceted approach to closing the women's wage gap - and to ensure the EEOC collects pay data by race, gender, and job category...
.

.

. . 
#VOICE and #VOTE to FORCE #Congress and the #EEOC to make sure we don't allow #gender and #race wage gaps to continue to shortchange women and their families!
.
#CloseTheGap

text:
Sydän täynnä.

Käsikirjoitukseen kuuluisi rakastaa Pariisia. Hehkuttaa sen valosta ja kauneudesta. Istun lähtöportilla. Lento on myöhässä. Minä haluaisin jo pois.

Olin täpötäydessä lentokentän ravintolassa. Missään ei näkynyt yhtään vapaata istumapaikkaa. Minulla oli tarjotin täynnä ruokaa, mutta ei paikkaa jossa olisin syönyt sen. Edessäni oli tyhjä kahdeksan hengen pöytä - sitä vartioi kaksi ranskalaista ilman ruokaa. Sitten tein virheen. Kysyin että sopisiko että söisin nopeasti tässä teidän pöydässänne ennenkuin ystävänne saapuvat? Istuin alas.

Ei olisi kannattanut. Mies huusi naama punaisena että se ei mitenkään käy. Ei, ei käy. Ja että minä olen hullu ja huora. Että minun on mentävä pois, ihan sama minne. Mies toisti sanansa niin moneen kertaan, että ne menivät varmasti perille - fou, putain. Kaikki tuijottivat. Jähmetyin ihan lukkoon.

Minne minä menen, kysyin mieheltä. Missä minä voin olla? Näetkö, koko tässä ravintolassa ei ole paikkaa minulle.

Mies loikkasi vihanpuuskassa ravintolan toiselle laidalle ja riuhtaisi kouraansa tuolin, ryntäsi ravintolan toiseen laitaan ja läjäytti tuolin maahan. Tuossa on sinun paikkasi, hullu huora!

Istuin alas osoitettuun paikkaan. Koko ravintola tuijotti minua. Persona non grata. Sitten aloin itkeä. Itkin niin kauan kuin kyyneleitä riitti.

Paikallaolijoiden kunniaksi pitää sanoa, että muutama ihminen tuli taputtamaan olkaa ja kysymään miten voin. Puhunko ranskaa, englantia, venäjää? He sanoivat: mitä juuri tapahtui, se ei ole sinun syytäsi.

Olen etuoikeutettu ihminen. Useimmiten suojassa tuntemattomien vihalta. Nyt kuitenkin tunsin luita ja ytimiä myöten, miltä tuntuu olla tunkeilija, muukalainen, alempiarvoinen.

Jonkun toisen viha ja kauna, nyt minun kannettavanani. En tiedä minne sen panisin. Siksi kirjaan sen tänne.

#trip #travel #work #worktrip #misogynist #muukalainen #vieras #toinen

text:
Anzeige! wegen Slutshaming 🐸
▪️▪️▪️▪️▪️▪️▪️
Gestern habe ich mich mit ein paar Bekannten in meinem Gym unterhalten, es wurde gefrotzelt, geschäkert, man sprach über dies und jenes.
Dann mischte sich ein weiterer Typ ins Gespräch ein uns riss binnen kürzester Zeit die ganze Unterhaltung an sich. Irgendwie kamen wir bzw. er dann auf das Thema Frauen, die viel Haut im Gym zeigen, wo die Brüste fast „rausfallen“, die angeguckt werden wollen. Auf meine vielfache Erwiderung, dass ihn das nichts anginge und Frauen anziehen könnten, was sie wollten, wies er mich darauf hin, dass diese Frauen ja kein Selbstbewusstsein hätten. Und ich erwiderte, das sei völlig egal, es mache sie qualitativ nicht minderwertig. Und er: Doch, die verkaufen sich unter Wert. Die wollen ja angegafft/angesprochen/belästigt werden. Ich sage: das ist die gleiche Argumentation, wie wenn jemand sagt, sie hat die Vergewaltigung ja provoziert, weil sie einen kurzen Rock anhatte. Er sagt, na ja, die verkaufen sich unter wert 🤨
Außerdem fand er es noch wichtig zu erwähnen, dass er eher auf Hintern als Brüste schaut 🤮
1. Diese Frauen verkaufen sich nicht, denn sie sind keine Ware 
2. Seit wann bestimmt die Kleidung darüber, wie wertvoll eine Person ist? 
3. Ein niedriges Selbstbewusstsein ist ein bisschen blöd (wenn das überhaupt der Grund ist, mein Gott, ich trage auch gerne enge Outfits 🙄), aber dadurch ist jemand doch nicht verachtenswert
4. und warum glauben Männer wie er eigentlich, dass sich immer alles nur um sie dreht? 
Der Punkt ist der: Es gibt keine wertvollen und unwertvollen Frauen. Slutshaming ist ekelhaft und sexistisch. Sich daran aufgeilen, dass man Brüste sieht und dann die Frau dafür runtermachen, ist einfach widerlich. Und: Selbst wenn Frauen sich so anziehen, dass sie von Männern angeguckt werden wollen, wollen sie trotzdem nicht angefasst oder niedergemacht werden. Sexy Frauen sind klasse. Unsexy Frauen auch. Knappe Sportoutfits sind toll. Schlabberjogger auch. ▪️▪️▪️▪️▪️▪️▪️▪️
#slutshaming #misogynie #feminismus #misogynist #gymbro #sexist #sexismus #kreuzheben #deadlift #powerlifting #femalepowerlifting #kraftdreikampf #girlswhopowerlift #lifting #liftingheavy
comments: |Oh man, da möchte man nur im Strahl 🤮 Aber nach seiner Logik müssten Männer genauso ein niedriges Selbstbewusstsein etc haben, wenn sie oberkörperfrei rumlaufen 🤔|💪💪💪✌️✌️✌️|This 🔥 @celinegrenouille|Hahahaha man braucht VIEL Selbstbewusstsein um viel Haut zu zeigen und enge Kleidung zu tragen WTF ich hasse alle Leute|👍👍🔥|Im Grunde genommen sind wir ja alle Geschenke dieser Erde, die Frage ist halt ob wir das erkennen oder nicht. text:
#wip What do you think? Would you wear this on a shirt or buy a print? I made this #poem #art using #procreate in response to all the men I encounter on the street that tell me to #smile on a regular basis. It’s seriously annoying to be told to “smile, pretty” or “where’s my smile at girl” #stoptellingwomentosmile - what if I’m having a shit day? It’s not a friendly gesture dudes, it’s insulting and condescending and just one #misogynist #microaggression ... I don’t exist for your pleasure. I don’t smile on demand. .
Before I finalize this artwork, I need some #peerfeedback What do you think about the vibe? Too serial killer? Yes? No? I drew the artwork using #truegrittexturesupply #debaser coloring kit and digitally clipped and piecemealed vintage newspaper headlines. My partner thinks it looks cool but it might look too much like a serial killer letter, but that made me think it’s even more effective, like a counter to the fact that bad men use this strategy for their thrills - I too can write a threatening letter!
#digitalart #feministart #illustration #illustrator #artist #feminism #feminist #stopstreetharassment

It’s awesome! ❤️🙌|@iamhalsey|It’s hard to believe this is an actual complaint.|All this support is fueling my 🔥 AND I even got trolled 😂|Amazing! ❤️

text:
After surviving from a very stressful #Thursday when I've just burned down a bridge and rebuilt it overnight and  random #ghosting incident that ruined my #Friday night, I am so glad that I could spend a very great afternoon with the brightest Ms @rosalianamsaiengchuan , - a #social #anthropologist and #filmmaker from Berlin who's about to finish her PhD research in cinematic practices of Indonesia. So glad she could manage to come back to Jakarta on her last day in tanah air 😇😇🥰
.
We started out our afternoon by entering a small worn out wooden door to eat one of the best ramen we've been craving for and exploring the basement of Blok M to actually dancing and admiring old books, om Roma Irama, jenang dodol, and random things. As we wait for the car to pick us up, we were bitching about the ridiculous world of #misogynist while sipping my hot black coffee.
.
The journey continued to @ruci.art
to catch some talks and book launch and of course to 'work out' in their current #exhibition 🤭 (i'll share more about this some other time after chewing the whole book)
.
Super thankful that I am surrounded by so many amazing friends who inspires and challenges me to be the best version of myself 💌🙇‍♀️
.

text:
Victim blaming is something that has sprung up in societal discussion in the modern age of the internet but its not a new phenomenon.

It's basic human error thinking that causes victim blaming. We go through these errors of judgement DAILY, yet are often not as obvious as when we victim blame.

In this video i talk about why its going to be difficult to eradicate the error of victim-blaming. But also how we can start fixing it... it begins with caring for eachother and having true empathy for the HUMAN BEING behind the story.

text:
❗️Kadın düşmanlığı (mizojini), kadınlara karşı duyulan soğukluk, antipati ya da  abartılı düşmanlıktır. İngilizcedeki "misogyny" terimi Yunancadaki kadın (gyne) ve nefret etmek (misein) kelimelerinden türetilmiştir. #JackHolland tarafından yazılan Mizojini; Kadından Nefretin Evrensel Tarihi bu düşmanlığın ne denli köklü ve eski olduğunu anlatıyor. ❗️Kadın karşıtı cinsiyetçilik ile karşılaştırıldığında kadın düşmanlığı (misogyny), genelde erkeklerde görülen kadın karşıtlığı olduğu gibi bazı kadınlarda da buna ilişkin bir tutum  görülebilmektedir.
❗️Feminist teoride kadın düşmanlığı, erkeklerin kadını ikinci plana attığı düşünülen ırkçılık ya da Yahudi-karşıtlığına benzer politik bir ideoloji olarak değerlendirilir.
❗️Ruhsal bir bozukluktan ileri gelebileceği gibi, sıklıkla bireyin çocukluktaki yaşantılarından, bunların özellikle anne ve babaya ilişkin olanlarından kaynaklanır. Gerek erkeklerde, gerekse kadınlarda görülebilir. ❗️Anne ve babanın Oedipus kompleksi dönemini yaşayan çocuklar karşısında takındıkları yanlış tutum, sergiledikleri yanlış davranış böyle bir duruma neden olabilir.

text:
The internalised misogynist inside of myself (I effing hate her) tells me that women shouldn't do 'certain things' because of the sexist narrative our society has laid out for us. It is through years of re-training that I have minimised the power she has over my thoughts...judging other women is just a quick way to get out of dealing with the things we dislike about OURSELVES. We seek comfort in other women's perceived 'flaws' in an attempt to avoid addressing our own insecurities
• 
Every time you catch yourself critiquing a woman on the choices that she makes, who she sleeps with, how she dresses...sit in it. Reflect. What is it about her that makes you feel so uncomfortable? Maybe she reminds you of yourself. The parts of yourself that you are ashamed of. Perhaps who you used to be? Or, maybe she's the very person you WANT to be? Making bold choices for herself that you are too afraid to? The choices that society has made you feel shameful of, because they go against the patriarchal narrative? Or maybe you just really fancy her and need to admit that ur queer and go ask her out?!
•
Ask yourself WHY you think this way. Reprogram your patriarchal brainwashing. The girl you're jealous and hateful of isn't a bitch, your internalised misogynist is. Give it a name. Tell it to eff off! It's ruining your relationship with other women

Reposted from @florencegiven

#misogyny #misogynist #endmisogyny #fuckthepatriarchy #feminism #feminist #internalizedmisogyny #internalizedsexism #womensupportwomen #womeninspirewomen #shinetheory

text:
We often have euphemisms for getting your period, but why is this? It may be a funny or less graphic alternative but part of its origin is definitely shame around periods. Even now, there is still a secrecy surrounding periods, such as when you hide your pad or tampon on the way to the toilet or feel embarrassed buying them at the cashier...this all adds to the stigma surrounding periods. So let’s try to be more open with our language and actions to try and end this!!❤️❤️
Credit to: @menstrualhealthhub for the post, @nataliebyrne for the beautiful art ❤️ #period #periods #activism #activist #feminism #feminist #periodproblems #endthestigma #endingperiodpoverty #periodpoverty #menstruationmatters #menstruation #periodpovertyisreal #endperiodpoverty #periodhumour #periodhumor #misogyny #misogynist #feminismo #feministart #feminismart #feministdoodles #feministartist #periodsarenormal #naturalnotdirty #periodeuphemisms #euphemism

text:
*Primitive prejudice misogynist
Dear Tamil movie industry*

Recently I watched Neerkonda Parvai, a tamil film directed by H.Vinoth. 
It was a Tamil remake of a Hindi film back in 2016. 
Disclaimer: This post contains spoilers regarding the movie; choice is in your hands. 
I am pretty impressed how this Tamil movie portrayed prejudice and discrimination towards women and male patriarchy. 
The story revolves around three young women persuaded by three guys to have dinner and drinks with them at a resort. One of these mischievous guys forced himself onto one of the girls and she resisted and refused to do anything sexual with him. He did not stopped so she instinctively grabbed a glass bottle beside her and smashed it into his head. The women escaped and his friends rushed him to the hospital. 
After a few days, the guys decided to threaten the girls by frightening their landlord to chase them out of the house, spreading edited explicit picture of one of the girls, stalking them and they even kidnapped one of the girls and molested her in the car. 
The situation escalated and they ended up in court. These three guys (from a high class and reputable background) decided to use whatever they can in their power to change the story. They stated that the girls requested them into having sexual contact with them in exchange for money and when the guys refused, one of the girls smashed the bottle onto his head. 
The story continues in court to show how these misogynistic men and their lawyer indirectly stated stereotypical and discriminative statements; -If a woman comes home late, she deserved whatever that happens to her at night -If a woman is unable to meet her financial requirements, she most likely resorted to prostitution. -If a woman talks and touches a guy in friendly manner, she is interested and even inviting him to have sex. *Continuation in comment section* 
Artwork: @maanushrinair

text:
Sheila (Name changed) from Haryana was in her 11th class when she started falling in love with a guy in her class at school. One of her classmate who is her neighbour told his family about sheila's relationship and they informed her father.
When confronted she denied but her phone was confiscated and it proved another way because of her chats with boyfriend. Beaten and stopped from going to school but her father a lawyer by profession soon became normal and would spend time with sheila. He would often ask her to join for evening walks and treat her well. Sheila was happy and proud of her loving father. Just within a month, her father planned a father-daughter trip to a hill station and sheila was excited as this was for the first time she would go out of Haryana. "We had dinner and then we moved to a room at my father's friends place, while we were in the room he started making drinks for himself and asked me to join. I refused and he didn't force me. After a few minutes, he asked me he wants to check if I am still a virgin and took off my clothes. I froze as if all of sudden it was not my father, he raped me twice that night and said this is all you wanted. isn't it good that you got it at your home? you gifted your virginity to your dad. That day I was not raped but my soul was murdered."
Her father died last year due to a cardiac attack. 
She is here on my Instagram account and before sharing her story I did ask for her permission.

मंगलसूत्र गले में है और मंगल पर है नजर कड़ी 
है आँखों में ब्रह्मांड बसा,काजल से है इतिहास रचा 
अनगिनत सितारों से तेरा आँचल हरदम आबाद रहे 
इस कांच की चूड़ी का रुआब सब को याद रहे 
यह सिंदूर दूर तक जाएगा

This poem is reestablishing all the symbols which have symbolized the subordination of women, attain their own identity and prove their worth in our regressive society.

Mangalsutra, Kajal, Aanchal, Kanch ki Chudi - why the heck are these the only identity of women, women of India? Why?

Despite of the major role of the women led team - the poster depicts India's nationalism poster boy Akshay Kumar on the main poster of the film.

The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) has written specific rules that protect people, mostly immigrants, against employment discrimination on the basis of their national origin. The agency is responsible for enforcing laws that prohibit discrimination and harassment based on race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age and disability. “Ethnic slurs and other verbal or physical conduct because of nationality are illegal if they are severe or pervasive and create an intimidating, hostile or offensive working environment, interfere with work performance, or negatively affect job opportunities,” the commission said on its website to describe harassment based on national origin. “Examples of potentially unlawful conduct include insults, taunting, or ethnic epithets, such as making fun of a person’s foreign accent or comments like, ‘Go back to where you came from,’ whether made by supervisors or co-workers,” it continued. (Sanjana Karanth/HuffPost Politics)

Ladies, have you ever experienced such misogyny, personally? ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

They are boys and forever will be. You do not get to be called a man. Na. You got to earn that. ⁣⁣⁣

text:

But these are only short lasting, and sometimes we have to think about long-term changes and routines/habits to form that really can be beneficial to our mental and physical health and happiness overall, that leave a bigger impact. 
Another gorgeous and important post from our fave @crazyheadcomics

text:
Via my friend John: “So, what will it really take? 
Boasting about groping women over a hot microphone wasn't enough. Unsavory remarks about random little girls riding escelators, or extolling the physical attributes of his own daughter to Howard Stern wasn't enough. Chiding female broadcasters, claiming that accusations of assault made by numerous women, wouldn't have happened because they weren't attractive enough to meet his standards, doesn't motivate. Associations with documented sex offenders, slanderous accusations texted about fellow, albeit female, Americans, sworn to uphold the constitution (just like the oath, he took) and no response of moral indignation from the GOP, home of the 'Moral Majority', so called, the champions of 'Family Values'... 🙈🙉🙊
There is a legal term, 'qui tacet consentire vidtur' (he who is silent is taken to agree) and in the faith that I was raised in, 'sin by omission' (if you can do something to abate wrong doing, and choose to do nothing, you are guilty of sin, as well), these concepts hit a nerve as I watch the news and try to keep my food down. 
Have the standards lowered so much? Is political gain worth the value of our collective national soul? 
Where is the line drawn in the sand?” #impeachtrump #racist #misogynist #bigot #criminalminds #lockhimup

How can any woman swallow his narcissistic racist sexist antics? It’s down right deplorable his behavior not even close to what a president should be

text:
I can’t tell you how many times I heard the authority figures in my life  criticize women for putting themselves first, for speaking up for themselves, for getting their hair done, and so on. These conversations told me to be selfless in a way that never prioritizes my own needs.
.
I think compassion and giving are critical acts of love. But they can’t come at the expense of self-love. When you find yourself in a place where you are forgetting yourself, remember the truest qualities that make you YOU. THAT should be celebrated always and first 💖 #radicalselflove

text:
HIKE LIKE A GIRL.

My friend @vally.climbs tagged me this post that shook me to my core. A brief background is a man posted a picture posing “like a girl.” This sentence angers me. Angers me to the point where I have no words. Today, however, I found those words.

Girls. Females. Vagina owners. Trans gender. Non-binary. You. Are. Enough. You are MORE than enough. Misogynistic humans have no right or power of opinion over YOU. Just because you are a GIRL, FEMALE, HUMAN WITH A VAGINA, TRANS GENDER, NON BINARY, does NOT lower your worth. 
I’m so sick of living in a world that, based on your sex, you are less valued. I hate that items that can be owned often have the female value placed on it. Cars? Often referred to as a female (“here she is” in reference to the car). I hate that women are often paid less than a man. I hate that women are expected to change their last name when married. I hate that women are expected to stay home with kids with (often) NO expectation for the father to be the stay at home parent. I hate that there are laws placed over women’s decisions with their bodies and NO laws placed over the man and his ejaculation. .

YOU- YES YOU, THE WOMAN READING THIS- YOU ARE VALUED.  YOU are important. YOU can change the world. YOU LIVE YOUR LIFE HOW YOU BEST KNOW AND WANT TO. Pose for pictures how you want, you hike when/how/what you want. Break out of the boundaries pushed upon you. And go friken hike like a human. Hike like a person. Hike proudly. Explore proudly. Raise people up. Be good, do good. Hike like a girl. #hikelikeagirl .

Thank you 
@tandemtrekking for bringing light and creating a community as we re-write what it means to #hikelikeagirl .

J’ai voulu quitter le restaurant #LeChantDesVoyelles sans payant la facture après j’ai vu la signe pour les #toilettes. La #misogynie est répugnante, pas cute et jamais drôle. J’ai du tourner mon chaise pour regarder quelque chose d’autre durant le repas. J’ai fait une #promenade pour deux heures aujourd’hui toute seule. J’ai écouté des musiques avec mes écouteurs 🎧. Deux #femmes m’a approchées, une pour la promotion des produits de #maquillage de @aircosmeticsparis, et une pour me dire que je suis très #belle et pour me #souhaiter un #bonne journée. Les deux c’étaient #bienvenues 😊 😊. J’étais un peu #dépressive après ça. J’ai appelé ma #chère #amie avant que rejoindre #maMari et ses collègues #pour les #boissons avant le souper à le #restaurant #misogynist, @le.chant.des.voyelles.

text:
Alih-alih praktik setrika payudara untuk melindungi anak dari pelecehan seksual dan pemerkosaan, praktik ini justru merupakan tindakan kekerasan seksual terhadap anak yang dapat menyebabkan luka fisik dan trauma psikologis, kesulitan mengeluarkan ASI, kelainan fisik, hingga kanker payudara.

Praktik setrika payudara menunjukkan budaya misoginis yang menopang praktik-praktik pelecehan seksual lainnya. Para praktisinya berangkat dari asumsi bahwa seorang gadis belum siap untuk menikah atau punya anak jika payudaranya tak berkembang.

Untuk melindungi perempuan dari pelecehan seksual ya gak gini juga dong caranya 😢😡

text:
Today @davidykim and I went for a walk to talk before getting our child from preschool. We went down to the boardwalk. I’m from SELA and we have lived in this area for 10Plus years. Today while taking a walk on the boardwalk a man verbally assaulted both Dave and I. Dave for his race and I for being born with a uterus. 😦😑😑😐😶 I have no words. We expressed kindness towards him, empathy through his anger. I found this tree moments later and needed a photo.

Our time is divided, yet at any juncture we can simply be kind. Choose kindness. Choose care. Choose empathy. It’s our only way out.  The human that verbally assaulted Dave with race and I with sexual harm was the dude with the red white and blue cap on. His eyes where not right. I feel for him. My homies on boardwalk- keep an eye 👁 on that human. #racism #racist #misogynist

comments:
|Something that humans in general need to understand, nobody owes you shit. They don’t owe you respect. They don’t owe you love. They don’t owe you friendship. They don’t even owe you the courtesy of holding the door as you both exit the store. 
That also means you don’t owe anyone else a damn thing. You don’t owe them patience. You don’t owe them understanding after they hurt you. You don’t owe them respect, especially if they haven’t earned it. 
Be nice because it’s the right thing to do. Let people live their lives. Don’t impose your morals on their lives. 
And for fucks sake, if you want to be a part of society, understand that part of being a part of any society, is helping others. You don’t owe anyone help, but they damn well don’t owe you participation in the society; help because it’s the right thing to do, and maybe because you might need help someday.

text:
"The new protector from the future is a machine fighter. It’s a painful life, and they’re scarred and take a lot of drugs to combat the pain of what’s been done to them. They don’t live a long time. It’s a very sacrificial role; they risk death to save others. And from the very first suggestion it was always a woman. We had to look for someone who has the physicality, but I’m very sensitive to actors. I didn’t just want a woman who could physically fit the role but emotionally as well. #MackenzieDavis really wanted to do it; she came after the role. She worked harder than anybody.

If you’re at all enlightened, she’ll play like gangbusters. If you’re a closet #misogynist, she’ll scare the fuck out of you, because she’s tough and strong but very feminine. We did not trade certain #gender traits for others; she’s just very strong, and that frightens some dudes. You can see online the responses to some of the early shit that’s out there, trolls on the internet. I don’t give a fuck." - #TimMiller (#Director #TerminatorDarkFate)

text:
I’m compiling a list of every time I have encountered misogyny and sexism.
Every cat call, every insult, every grope, every manipulation, every snide comment, every passive aggressive behaviour that I can remember. 
It’s going to be honest, nothing will be exaggerated and everything will be to the point.
These are my encounters as a white woman of privilege. If you read them, I urge take a second to think about what they are like for women of colour. 
Probably going to tweet it as a series. It will be never ending as this shit doesn’t seem to have an expiry date.

I’m over it, fed up and I’m not going to be quiet. 
I encourage you to do the same.

text:
Let me borrow the words of #Christ to begin the shaking of a table I have tagged “African sexism in historical context”

In today’s world many have learnt to jump on #bandwagons without critical and historical thinking! The high level of #mentalslavery has blinded us from deep appreciation of our truest self

If you ask 10 #Africans about their views on sexism/feminism in Africa - 7 in 10 will argue it is a highly #misogynist society - where women’s rights are subdued

Would I say they are right? Absolutely yes! In present day #Africa , due to the popularity of literary & elitist male chauvinists - we have three types of sexism - #Malignantsexism a view that “there’s hardly any good in a woman & #benignsexism which says by nature women are inferior to men

The third is #benevolentsexism (which I would confess I easily fell prey to) this is the view that because women are inferior (however subtly this is believed) they need special care & attention

However in the beginning it was not so! No I don’t mean the #bible beginning, I mean in African #mythology & #history it was not so

Take for instance the mythology of Creation in #Yoruba culture - one of 3 myths states when Olódùmaré (God) sent men òrisà’s (simply means Legends in today’s world) to populate the earth & one woman Òsun

Because these #men ignored the only #female in their midst, everything went wrong

When they went back to Olòdùmarè (God) He made it abundantly clear they would continue to fail, unless & until they involve the woman in ALL social institutions!

It is clear that ancient Yoruba thinkers who formulated these myths, not only admitted the presence of male chauvinism but more importantly they refused to depict women as an inferior creation but rather as an intellectually gifted being

Don’t believe popular thinking more than you do critical thinking!

I told you I’m coming out!

Well 🤔 well 🤔 happy weekend 😉
#sheundavidonamusi #afrisapien #saturday #morning #osun #orisa
comments: |Hmmmm.... 🤔🤔

text:
•JUST A COFFEE THOUGHT•
I have 15 minutes to kill while waiting for the tram to head home and decide to splurge on an ice blended coffee. I've scratched out 3 poems which had beginnings but no endings. This style of narrating is called "stream of consciousness"; writing down your thoughts as they are flowing through your mind. Wait, a small chunk of chocolate is stuck in my straw. There, done. I have 12 more minutes to go.

There was a man in the tram on my way to town who was talking very loudly on the phone. He repeatedly said, "She's just a woman, asshole! You left bruises on her and I have to shut her up. Leave her alone with me tomorrow, I'll handle it." He then wiped the beads of sweat on his eyebrows. [scratched out profanities which followed - you can see it on the photo above]

I was baffled, truly. No, you are the butt hole. Nobody is just a woman or just a man. 
I gave him a disgusted look but the smug on his face stayed. My stop came and I had to leave. Tomorrow, I will think about that woman who was just a woman to him. I hope she won't just let it slide. She should just kick him between his legs and just leave her mark in his memories. For the rest of his life he should just remember; he is just an asshole and she is just a woman. 3 minutes to go - I have to leave the cafe. 
#readmyvoice #latenightthoughts #poem #prose #iwrite #poetry #poetsofinstagram #writersofinstagram #writer #words #shortstory #srtoriesoninstagram #instastories #misogynist #justawoman

text:
I don’t know about you guys, but I don't recall seeing any examples growing up of fierce ♀️ female friendship/comradery, let alone loud & proud (or quiet & proud) 🏳️‍🌈 #queer/#lesbian folks.
💫
The #meangirl phenomenon (which when unchecked, easily morphs into mean woman) is rampant, and turns into the whole #competition & #comparison thing, wherein so many amazing #women distrust one another and enact all the barriers of disconnection, rather than leaning in TO one another.
💫
It’s understandable how it unfolds when living in #misogynist #colonist (and other) cultures that render #females second class, invisible citizens to begin with (and pitted against one another BY men), let alone SEEN & RESPECTED as the whole, complex, delightful creatures that we are. All of this makes the process of realizing/becoming/being a queer woman unnecessarily difficult for a lot of us, including entering the queer/lesbian scene, which is not a big, communal “welcome home” hug for everyone that walks through its gates. For some, it’s like that cliquey highschool vibe all over again.
💫
#BroadCity is such a powerful show for so many reasons. Abbi & Ilana have done so much for #womanhood by simply being their delightful selves, thereby giving permission for other girls & women to be THEMSELVES/OURSELVES. There is so much POWER in #sisterhood, whether we are #bisexual, straight, #gay or whatever label you/we resonate with. This #collective power is what I want, need and work at cultivating, in my “real” life and right here in our mighty #community. And it starts with undoing & purging that poisonous #sexism & #misogyny out of our OWN system, as well as #racism #homophobia #ableism #classism & #ageism that accompanies it.
💫
Quote is from an article about the divide between females, called “The Girl Wars Must End,” by Eileen Pollack 👇
💫
https://humanparts.medium.com/the-girl-wars-must-end-9e4b15b7403b
💫
More about Broad City in comments 👇
.
#LGBT #LGBTQ #mentalhealth #emotionalhealth #spiritualhealth #culturalhealth #psychology
comments:
|About the show:
“Broad City” centered around Abbi and Ilana playing characters of the same name and their adventures in New York City. The show originally debuted as a web series on YouTube. The series gained a following and attracted the attention of Amy Poehler, who was an early member of the Upright Citizens Brigade improv group that the two were alums of. Jacobson and Glazer developed the series with Poehler serving as executive producer and the show debuted on Comedy Central in January, 2014. It received great acclaim from critics including two nominations for Best Comedy Series and another two for Glazer as Best Comedy Actress at the Critics’ Choice TV Awards in 2014 and 2015.
Above excerpt + image source:
👇

text:
I'll never actually understand the little boy brain.
I remember moving to Virginia at age 13, just hit puberty...new girl in town! I can't hide my Lithuanian name. Being raised European you don't see anything sexual about the human body, boobs are boobs, weenies are weenies, life moves on...sheesh. 
I remember starting school and making friends but it was only guys that were coming at me with the "oh you're exotic, I hear you Europeans are the best to fuck"...at age 13 I was introduced to this idea that I am just a piece of meat to fuck. Next thing you know, the bathroom stalls are written in "Sigi is a SLUT" all over the stalls, they had to paint over it all. But I remember sitting there just wondering what did I actually do? I never was flirting with people. Girls just didn't want to become friends with me and actually faked being friends to get "dirt"? I for years wondered why people just automatically just had this idea about who I am without ever getting to know me and only knowing me by my appearance. It genuinely hurt. But it makes sense now. It still doesn't but I get it. People are intimidated and only thing they can do to make their dicks feel bigger is to just stomp someone in the dirt. It actually never made sense to me. I remember meeting people for the first time but they would start telling me all these things about me that I've never heard and don't even know where it comes from....but they know such and so so they "know" me. I don't get it. What about someone appearance just gives you their whole story? I genuinely don't get it. Little dick energy is real and I hate it. Be gone! 💪
#growup #slut #littledickenergy #boys #intimidation #misogyny #misogynist #misoginia #scared

text:
Greenpeace activists.

I have worked in a large gallery for ten years. I never say which because we are not supposed to talk about stuff that goes on. However, I’ve got something good-ish to say (for once) about whoever makes the rules there.

I don’t think I’m giving too much away if I say my employer receives money from BP, since a lot of museums do. And so ‘we’ get protesters.

The gallery stance is to spot activists before they get in, and keep them out. Easier said than done, with budgets lower than ever. Most of my colleagues privately have total sympathy with Greenpeace. Not sure about the top brass, mind. 
I have seen many protesters and they have ALL been polite, quiet, non-violent and have left absolutely no mess behind.
We are told never to touch them and to calmly let them get on with their peaceful protest, which is over before you know it, and to make sure the public (who are never in any danger) come to no harm. 
Grabbing a protester, the way Mark Field did, is totally unprofessional.

The above picture is uncredited and taken from this weekend’s i. It shows him grabbing Lucia Hunt. You can read the full article in one of my posts from a week ago, as I stitched Ms Hunt to my ‘thing’ as the ‘face of the day’ on account of this ‘kiss’. It’s the post where the first image is Gove and Stewart, but if you scroll along, you can see this other unprofessional incident. And also about how the Foreign Secretary referred to his partner as Japanese, when she is actually Chinese.

Happy Sunday.

#markfield #greenpeace #luciahunt #jeremyhunt #foreignsecretary #grabembythepussy #blacktiedinner #janetbaker #peoplelikeyou #disturbourdinner #peoplelikeus #blacktie #misogynist #misogyny #bunchofbastards #theyreincharge #feministart

But I am still looking, and I feel I could do something physically damaging to these men if I got near them.|The time to worry is when we are no longer enraged, when open misogyny is so commonplace that we expect it. We need to stay angry, to challenge appalling behaviour, to call out the people who think it is apparently acceptable to parade their disgusting, entitled attitudes wherever they are. And we have to be angry not just for ourselves, but for the women who are so brainwashed by these attitudes that they don't think there is anything wrong. I'm still failing to understand those placards that read "Women for Trump" 😠😓 Keep up the good work, Alison, this is essential stuff ❤️|The way Field marched her out by the neck really got to me. He never would have done that to a man. He also could have let security escort her but he didn't. Disgusting.|I hadn’t seen this image before & I can’t believe what I’m seeing. The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) has written specific rules that protect people, mostly immigrants, against employment discrimination on the basis of their national origin. The agency is responsible for enforcing laws that prohibit discrimination and harassment based on race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age and disability. “Ethnic slurs and other verbal or physical conduct because of nationality are illegal if they are severe or pervasive and create an intimidating, hostile or offensive working environment, interfere with work performance, or negatively affect job opportunities,” the commission said on its website to describe harassment based on national origin. “Examples of potentially unlawful conduct include insults, taunting, or ethnic epithets, such as making fun of a person’s foreign accent or comments like, ‘Go back to where you came from,’ whether made by supervisors or co-workers,” it continued. (Sanjana Karanth/HuffPost Politics)

text:
Sometimes, self care can be a face mask, a bath or a chocolate bar. But these are only short lasting, and sometimes we have to think about long-term changes and routines/habits to form that really can be beneficial to our mental and physical health and happiness overall, that leave a bigger impact. 
Another gorgeous and important post from our fave @crazyheadcomics

text:
Via my friend John: “So, what will it really take? 
Boasting about groping women over a hot microphone wasn't enough. Unsavory remarks about random little girls riding escelators, or extolling the physical attributes of his own daughter to Howard Stern wasn't enough. Chiding female broadcasters, claiming that accusations of assault made by numerous women, wouldn't have happened because they weren't attractive enough to meet his standards, doesn't motivate. Associations with documented sex offenders, slanderous accusations texted about fellow, albeit female, Americans, sworn to uphold the constitution (just like the oath, he took) and no response of moral indignation from the GOP, home of the 'Moral Majority', so called, the champions of 'Family Values'... 🙈🙉🙊
There is a legal term, 'qui tacet consentire vidtur' (he who is silent is taken to agree) and in the faith that I was raised in, 'sin by omission' (if you can do something to abate wrong doing, and choose to do nothing, you are guilty of sin, as well), these concepts hit a nerve as I watch the news and try to keep my food down. 
Have the standards lowered so much? Is political gain worth the value of our collective national soul? 
Where is the line drawn in the sand?” #impeachtrump #racist #misogynist #bigot #criminalminds #lockhimup

text:
HIKE LIKE A GIRL.

My friend @vally.climbs tagged me this post that shook me to my core. A brief background is a man posted a picture posing “like a girl.” This sentence angers me. Angers me to the point where I have no words. Today, however, I found those words.

Girls. Females. Vagina owners. Trans gender. Non-binary. You. Are. Enough. You are MORE than enough. Misogynistic humans have no right or power of opinion over YOU. Just because you are a GIRL, FEMALE, HUMAN WITH A VAGINA, TRANS GENDER, NON BINARY, does NOT lower your worth. 
I’m so sick of living in a world that, based on your sex, you are less valued. I hate that items that can be owned often have the female value placed on it. Cars? Often referred to as a female (“here she is” in reference to the car). I hate that women are often paid less than a man. I hate that women are expected to change their last name when married. I hate that women are expected to stay home with kids with (often) NO expectation for the father to be the stay at home parent. I hate that there are laws placed over women’s decisions with their bodies and NO laws placed over the man and his ejaculation. .

YOU- YES YOU, THE WOMAN READING THIS- YOU ARE VALUED.  YOU are important. YOU can change the world. YOU LIVE YOUR LIFE HOW YOU BEST KNOW AND WANT TO. Pose for pictures how you want, you hike when/how/what you want. Break out of the boundaries pushed upon you. And go friken hike like a human. Hike like a person. Hike proudly. Explore proudly. Raise people up. Be good, do good. Hike like a girl. #hikelikeagirl .

Thank you 
@tandemtrekking for bringing light and creating a community as we re-write what it means to #hikelikeagirl .

J’ai voulu quitter le restaurant #LeChantDesVoyelles sans payant la facture après j’ai vu la signe pour les #toilettes. La #misogynie est répugnante, pas cute et jamais drôle. J’ai du tourner mon chaise pour regarder quelque chose d’autre durant le repas. J’ai fait une #promenade pour deux heures aujourd’hui toute seule. J’ai écouté des musiques avec mes écouteurs 🎧. Deux #femmes m’a approchées, une pour la promotion des produits de #maquillage de @aircosmeticsparis, et une pour me dire que je suis très #belle et pour me #souhaiter un #bonne journée. Les deux c’étaient #bienvenues 😊 😊. J’étais un peu #dépressive après ça. J’ai appelé ma #chère #amie avant que rejoindre #maMari et ses collègues #pour les #boissons avant le souper à le #restaurant #misogynist, @le.chant.des.voyelles.

text:
Alih-alih praktik setrika payudara untuk melindungi anak dari pelecehan seksual dan pemerkosaan, praktik ini justru merupakan tindakan kekerasan seksual terhadap anak yang dapat menyebabkan luka fisik dan trauma psikologis, kesulitan mengeluarkan ASI, kelainan fisik, hingga kanker payudara.

Praktik setrika payudara menunjukkan budaya misoginis yang menopang praktik-praktik pelecehan seksual lainnya. Para praktisinya berangkat dari asumsi bahwa seorang gadis belum siap untuk menikah atau punya anak jika payudaranya tak berkembang.

Untuk melindungi perempuan dari pelecehan seksual ya gak gini juga dong caranya 😢😡

text:
Today @davidykim and I went for a walk to talk before getting our child from preschool. We went down to the boardwalk. I’m from SELA and we have lived in this area for 10Plus years. Today while taking a walk on the boardwalk a man verbally assaulted both Dave and I. Dave for his race and I for being born with a uterus. 😦😑😑😐😶 I have no words. We expressed kindness towards him, empathy through his anger. I found this tree moments later and needed a photo.

Our time is divided, yet at any juncture we can simply be kind. Choose kindness. Choose care. Choose empathy. It’s our only way out.  The human that verbally assaulted Dave with race and I with sexual harm was the dude with the red white and blue cap on. His eyes where not right. I feel for him. My homies on boardwalk- keep an eye 👁 on that human. #racism #racist #misogynist

comments:
|Something that humans in general need to understand, nobody owes you shit. They don’t owe you respect. They don’t owe you love. They don’t owe you friendship. They don’t even owe you the courtesy of holding the door as you both exit the store. 
That also means you don’t owe anyone else a damn thing. You don’t owe them patience. You don’t owe them understanding after they hurt you. You don’t owe them respect, especially if they haven’t earned it. 
Be nice because it’s the right thing to do. Let people live their lives. Don’t impose your morals on their lives. 
And for fucks sake, if you want to be a part of society, understand that part of being a part of any society, is helping others. You don’t owe anyone help, but they damn well don’t owe you participation in the society; help because it’s the right thing to do, and maybe because you might need help someday.

text:
"The new protector from the future is a machine fighter. It’s a painful life, and they’re scarred and take a lot of drugs to combat the pain of what’s been done to them. They don’t live a long time. It’s a very sacrificial role; they risk death to save others. And from the very first suggestion it was always a woman. We had to look for someone who has the physicality, but I’m very sensitive to actors. I didn’t just want a woman who could physically fit the role but emotionally as well. #MackenzieDavis really wanted to do it; she came after the role. She worked harder than anybody.

If you’re at all enlightened, she’ll play like gangbusters. If you’re a closet #misogynist, she’ll scare the fuck out of you, because she’s tough and strong but very feminine. We did not trade certain #gender traits for others; she’s just very strong, and that frightens some dudes. You can see online the responses to some of the early shit that’s out there, trolls on the internet. I don’t give a fuck." - #TimMiller (#Director #TerminatorDarkFate)

text:
I’m compiling a list of every time I have encountered misogyny and sexism.
Every cat call, every insult, every grope, every manipulation, every snide comment, every passive aggressive behaviour that I can remember. 
It’s going to be honest, nothing will be exaggerated and everything will be to the point.
These are my encounters as a white woman of privilege. If you read them, I urge take a second to think about what they are like for women of colour. 
Probably going to tweet it as a series. It will be never ending as this shit doesn’t seem to have an expiry date.

I’m over it, fed up and I’m not going to be quiet. 
I encourage you to do the same.

text:
Let me borrow the words of #Christ to begin the shaking of a table I have tagged “African sexism in historical context”

In today’s world many have learnt to jump on #bandwagons without critical and historical thinking! The high level of #mentalslavery has blinded us from deep appreciation of our truest self

If you ask 10 #Africans about their views on sexism/feminism in Africa - 7 in 10 will argue it is a highly #misogynist society - where women’s rights are subdued

Would I say they are right? Absolutely yes! In present day #Africa , due to the popularity of literary & elitist male chauvinists - we have three types of sexism - #Malignantsexism a view that “there’s hardly any good in a woman & #benignsexism which says by nature women are inferior to men

The third is #benevolentsexism (which I would confess I easily fell prey to) this is the view that because women are inferior (however subtly this is believed) they need special care & attention

However in the beginning it was not so! No I don’t mean the #bible beginning, I mean in African #mythology & #history it was not so

Take for instance the mythology of Creation in #Yoruba culture - one of 3 myths states when Olódùmaré (God) sent men òrisà’s (simply means Legends in today’s world) to populate the earth & one woman Òsun

Because these #men ignored the only #female in their midst, everything went wrong

When they went back to Olòdùmarè (God) He made it abundantly clear they would continue to fail, unless & until they involve the woman in ALL social institutions!

It is clear that ancient Yoruba thinkers who formulated these myths, not only admitted the presence of male chauvinism but more importantly they refused to depict women as an inferior creation but rather as an intellectually gifted being

Don’t believe popular thinking more than you do critical thinking!

I told you I’m coming out!

Well 🤔 well 🤔 happy weekend 😉
#sheundavidonamusi #afrisapien #saturday #morning #osun #orisa
comments: |Hmmmm.... 🤔🤔

text:
•JUST A COFFEE THOUGHT•
I have 15 minutes to kill while waiting for the tram to head home and decide to splurge on an ice blended coffee. I've scratched out 3 poems which had beginnings but no endings. This style of narrating is called "stream of consciousness"; writing down your thoughts as they are flowing through your mind. Wait, a small chunk of chocolate is stuck in my straw. There, done. I have 12 more minutes to go.

There was a man in the tram on my way to town who was talking very loudly on the phone. He repeatedly said, "She's just a woman, asshole! You left bruises on her and I have to shut her up. Leave her alone with me tomorrow, I'll handle it." He then wiped the beads of sweat on his eyebrows. [scratched out profanities which followed - you can see it on the photo above]

I was baffled, truly. No, you are the butt hole. Nobody is just a woman or just a man. 
I gave him a disgusted look but the smug on his face stayed. My stop came and I had to leave. Tomorrow, I will think about that woman who was just a woman to him. I hope she won't just let it slide. She should just kick him between his legs and just leave her mark in his memories. For the rest of his life he should just remember; he is just an asshole and she is just a woman. 3 minutes to go - I have to leave the cafe. 
#readmyvoice #latenightthoughts #poem #prose #iwrite #poetry #poetsofinstagram #writersofinstagram #writer #words #shortstory #srtoriesoninstagram #instastories #misogynist #justawoman

text:
I don’t know about you guys, but I don't recall seeing any examples growing up of fierce ♀️ female friendship/comradery, let alone loud & proud (or quiet & proud) 🏳️‍🌈 #queer/#lesbian folks.
💫
The #meangirl phenomenon (which when unchecked, easily morphs into mean woman) is rampant, and turns into the whole #competition & #comparison thing, wherein so many amazing #women distrust one another and enact all the barriers of disconnection, rather than leaning in TO one another.
💫
It’s understandable how it unfolds when living in #misogynist #colonist (and other) cultures that render #females second class, invisible citizens to begin with (and pitted against one another BY men), let alone SEEN & RESPECTED as the whole, complex, delightful creatures that we are. All of this makes the process of realizing/becoming/being a queer woman unnecessarily difficult for a lot of us, including entering the queer/lesbian scene, which is not a big, communal “welcome home” hug for everyone that walks through its gates. For some, it’s like that cliquey highschool vibe all over again.
💫
#BroadCity is such a powerful show for so many reasons. Abbi & Ilana have done so much for #womanhood by simply being their delightful selves, thereby giving permission for other girls & women to be THEMSELVES/OURSELVES. There is so much POWER in #sisterhood, whether we are #bisexual, straight, #gay or whatever label you/we resonate with. This #collective power is what I want, need and work at cultivating, in my “real” life and right here in our mighty #community. And it starts with undoing & purging that poisonous #sexism & #misogyny out of our OWN system, as well as #racism #homophobia #ableism #classism & #ageism that accompanies it.
💫
Quote is from an article about the divide between females, called “The Girl Wars Must End,” by Eileen Pollack 👇
💫
https://humanparts.medium.com/the-girl-wars-must-end-9e4b15b7403b
💫
More about Broad City in comments 👇
.
#LGBT #LGBTQ #mentalhealth #emotionalhealth #spiritualhealth #culturalhealth #psychology
comments:
|About the show:
“Broad City” centered around Abbi and Ilana playing characters of the same name and their adventures in New York City. The show originally debuted as a web series on YouTube. The series gained a following and attracted the attention of Amy Poehler, who was an early member of the Upright Citizens Brigade improv group that the two were alums of. Jacobson and Glazer developed the series with Poehler serving as executive producer and the show debuted on Comedy Central in January, 2014. It received great acclaim from critics including two nominations for Best Comedy Series and another two for Glazer as Best Comedy Actress at the Critics’ Choice TV Awards in 2014 and 2015.
Above excerpt + image source:
👇

text:
I'll never actually understand the little boy brain.
I remember moving to Virginia at age 13, just hit puberty...new girl in town! I can't hide my Lithuanian name. Being raised European you don't see anything sexual about the human body, boobs are boobs, weenies are weenies, life moves on...sheesh. 
I remember starting school and making friends but it was only guys that were coming at me with the "oh you're exotic, I hear you Europeans are the best to fuck"...at age 13 I was introduced to this idea that I am just a piece of meat to fuck. Next thing you know, the bathroom stalls are written in "Sigi is a SLUT" all over the stalls, they had to paint over it all. But I remember sitting there just wondering what did I actually do? I never was flirting with people. Girls just didn't want to become friends with me and actually faked being friends to get "dirt"? I for years wondered why people just automatically just had this idea about who I am without ever getting to know me and only knowing me by my appearance. It genuinely hurt. But it makes sense now. It still doesn't but I get it. People are intimidated and only thing they can do to make their dicks feel bigger is to just stomp someone in the dirt. It actually never made sense to me. I remember meeting people for the first time but they would start telling me all these things about me that I've never heard and don't even know where it comes from....but they know such and so so they "know" me. I don't get it. What about someone appearance just gives you their whole story? I genuinely don't get it. Little dick energy is real and I hate it. Be gone! 💪
#growup #slut #littledickenergy #boys #intimidation #misogyny #misogynist #misoginia #scared

text:
Greenpeace activists.

I have worked in a large gallery for ten years. I never say which because we are not supposed to talk about stuff that goes on. However, I’ve got something good-ish to say (for once) about whoever makes the rules there.

I don’t think I’m giving too much away if I say my employer receives money from BP, since a lot of museums do. And so ‘we’ get protesters.

The gallery stance is to spot activists before they get in, and keep them out. Easier said than done, with budgets lower than ever. Most of my colleagues privately have total sympathy with Greenpeace. Not sure about the top brass, mind. 
I have seen many protesters and they have ALL been polite, quiet, non-violent and have left absolutely no mess behind.
We are told never to touch them and to calmly let them get on with their peaceful protest, which is over before you know it, and to make sure the public (who are never in any danger) come to no harm. 
Grabbing a protester, the way Mark Field did, is totally unprofessional.

The above picture is uncredited and taken from this weekend’s i. It shows him grabbing Lucia Hunt. You can read the full article in one of my posts from a week ago, as I stitched Ms Hunt to my ‘thing’ as the ‘face of the day’ on account of this ‘kiss’. It’s the post where the first image is Gove and Stewart, but if you scroll along, you can see this other unprofessional incident. And also about how the Foreign Secretary referred to his partner as Japanese, when she is actually Chinese.

Happy Sunday.

#markfield #greenpeace #luciahunt #jeremyhunt #foreignsecretary #grabembythepussy #blacktiedinner #janetbaker #peoplelikeyou #disturbourdinner #peoplelikeus #blacktie #misogynist #misogyny #bunchofbastards #theyreincharge #feministart

But I am still looking, and I feel I could do something physically damaging to these men if I got near them.|The time to worry is when we are no longer enraged, when open misogyny is so commonplace that we expect it. We need to stay angry, to challenge appalling behaviour, to call out the people who think it is apparently acceptable to parade their disgusting, entitled attitudes wherever they are. And we have to be angry not just for ourselves, but for the women who are so brainwashed by these attitudes that they don't think there is anything wrong. I'm still failing to understand those placards that read "Women for Trump" 😠😓 Keep up the good work, Alison, this is essential stuff ❤️|The way Field marched her out by the neck really got to me. He never would have done that to a man. He also could have let security escort her but he didn't. Disgusting.|I hadn’t seen this image before & I can’t believe what I’m seeing. text:
The character Kabir Singh, is basically an updated Devdas. The entire arc of the film is to somehow make his negativity attractive, explain it away as “unconventional” and have him find redemption despite his unforgivable ways. This remake is an unapologetic celebration of toxic masculinity.
Having watched and balked at Arjun Reddy for its celebration of a misogynistic, infantile bully of a hero, Kabir Singh felt like a doubly suffocating experience. One that makes you feel violated. Devdas at least had the headstrong Paro and graceful Chandramukhi, two beholden women alright but with personalities of their own, to bring some sense of balance to the man-woman game.  Here the woman is denied any agency whatsoever. Kiara Advani, who is a treat to watch on screen was actually not given more than 10 dialogues in the movie. She is a property, marked and owned by the man, who meekly follows him with eyes always down and is masochistic in allowing herself to bear with his violent ways. But later she falls in love with him, despite everything, because apparently he’s her protector and saviour.
The entire film, is dependent on and propelled by the performance of the star at the centre. And however good Shahid Kapoor might be in living the trauma and angst of the character, you still can’t get away from the sickening male entitlement. 
What does the filmmaker think women are meant for? Be sacrificial goats at the male altar? What fuels such proprietary behaviour in some men? What makes them think any woman they desire must return the sentiment? You keep waiting for the film to answer these questions, but they never come. Because this is not that kind of film. In fact as per the filmmakers – ITS INTENSE LOVE.
Kabir Singh is an unmistakably misogynistic film, but the sad part is that it’s exactly these troubling portions that the filmmakers peddle as intense love. If this is the great idea of man-woman dynamics, if this is a “hatke” love story, well just tell me another one. End of rant! - @cautiousdreamer_ 
Source : The Indian Express, New18,  The Hindu, India Today. 
#kabirsingh #review #movies #bollywood #shahidkapoor #kiaraadvani

text:
Feeling like you hit a brick wall?

No matter what you try, you can't find peace: •praying more
•volunteering to teach another Sunday School class
•submitting even more to your husband and pastor
•homeschooling your kids
•going on missions trips •joining another ministry school

I understand because I have been there.

There is whole new existence available

that I have experienced

and I am never going back to the do-more life.

I live in a place of glorious self-worth in Jesus' identity.

Imagine God's seal of approval is yours 
even when you are failing.

When you know this, believe this glorious good news,

there is no longer any need to work yourself up into his favor.

The result is immediate--rest and peace with yourself and God.

You will crave time hearing his voice of reassurance.

You will know your requests are answered and you will move on to listening.

And what you hear is pure unconditional love and adoration

even when you are doing nothing.

You can't stay there long until you will be chomping at the bit to find out what his destiny is for you.

Surprise! You already knew deep down your whole life.

You just got too busy listening to the church's mandates, listening to man instead of your adoring creator.

You have been created with gifts and a personality that weave together to make up your life purpose.

Fun and adventure result from cooperating with God instead of submitting to church.

Being able to hear him gently remind you how he formed you is the beginning of a life filled with the satisfaction of knowing where you fit in the Kingdom.

I've never been happier, and it is my mission to write to help women who have been churchified understand their worth.

Interested in hearing more and getting exclusive behind-the-scenes email updates in addition to blog posts, subscribe to my blog. Link in bio.

text:
#Repost @diet_prada
• • • • • •
@marceloburlon proving to be human garbage. Yesterday in Facebook post, the designer captioned a photo set of @madonna wearing the brand. An approximate translation reads: “And the time finally came that Madonna, la cessa, wore County [of Milan]. I want to guarantee that nobody has given her anything for free, but that she paid with your money.” “La cessa”, is an Italian slang word that basically means human toilet or to say that someone is ugly as f**k.  After deleting the Facebook post, Burlon began publicizing those same photos on Instagram stories 🙄🤮. Dieters, time to file him and his brand along with the other woman-shaming misogynist designers (Stefano and Philipp Plein, we’re looking at you). Swipe ▶️ for his lame ass apology plus some cringey hypocrisy.

text:
This energy>>>
-
I apologize for being so inactive on this account lately. I'm gonna be honest, I go through cycles where this account brings me more frustration than excitement. I love being able to have a platform and a voice, but sometimes I feel overwhelmed by bad news, horrible tragedies in the media, and people who reach out to me with heartbreaking stories. (Btw: this is not to say don't reach out to me; I'm always here to offer support and advice when needed). Having this account does take a slight toll on my mental health, and that fact coupled with the fact that summer vacation just started for me means that I'm not as active as I wish I could be. I'll post more often pretty soon but for now, it'll be maybe a post every other day. Thank you guys for understanding.
-

text:
“Slurs that you DID NOT reclaim, are not yours to use.” ⁣
⁣
Plain and simple. Historically, groups of people who have been oppressed have been known to RECLAIM terms that have been used by oppressors towards them. Reclamation is the reappropriation of slurs, and this can be used as a form of empowerment to many. When outsiders continue to use these words, whether it be to dehumanize others, or to “reclaim” it for themselves, it is insulting and disgraceful. Non-black people/Non-black POC using “nigga”, men using “bitch”, straight cis-gendered persons using LGBT slurs, etc.. Are examples of groups of people disregarding their social privileges and using terms that are not theirs to reclaim. Be mindful of the language you use and how it effects others. Respect other’s right to use terms that have been used against them, and check your privilege before you insert yourself into spaces that weren’t created for you. ⁣
⁣
#feminism #feminist #intersectionalfeminism #intersectionality #womensempowerment #reclamation #reclaimingslurs #socialprivilege #reappropriation #bodypositivity #bodypositive #sexpositivity #racism #sexism #ableism #ageism #homophobia #nohate #liberation #empowerment #thepowerofwords  #misogyny #misogynist #internalizedmisogyny

text:
Delivering the Mueller Report, in audiobook-style format, without political commentary. .
Due to the wide public interest in the "Report on the Investigation into Russian Interference in the 2016 Presidential Election," this project started with the belief that quality audio of the report should be available for anyone to hear -- and not hidden behind a paywall or require a subscription.

For most of us, sitting down to read through the report page-by-page is unrealistic. .
This is the report, available piece-by-piece, for anyone to access it and listen in manageable portions.

This podcast is not affiliated with or connected to the Special Counsel or the investigation.
.

text:
Ahead of his state visit to the UK, President Donald Trump has hit back at Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex, for her previous criticism of him during the election.
.
As a new royal, the Duchess is no longer supposed to be making comments that show political favor, but back in 2016 she was free to speak her mind. "Of course, Trump is divisive," Meghan said in a 2016 interview on The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore back when she was an actor on Suits. "Think about just female voters alone, right?"
.
The Los Angeles-born Meghan dubbed him "misogynistic...and so vocal about it," and said she was considering remaining in Canada, where she filmed Suits, if he won.
.
Asked Friday by the British newspaper the Sun about Meghan's past comments, Trump said he was unaware of her criticism.
.
“I didn’t know that," he said. "What can I say? I didn’t know that she was nasty.” (📷: Getty Images)

text: So Donald Trump is considering pardoning service members (mainly white men) for their war crimes of murder and brutality. He said ‘we teach them how to be great fighters, and when they fight sometime, they get really treated very unfairly’. America really is the land of the free.....for straight white men that is. Trump mocks female sexual assault victims, tells people its acceptable to grab women without consent, and supports the proposed laws that would mean, in some states, women could face the death sentence for terminating a pregnancy after 6 weeks. Yet he thinks that people like Navy SEAL Eddie Gallagher can be excused for deliberately targeting civilians while deployed to Iraq. If only he could use the same insight to look at why people from the poorest communities are the most likely to be involved in gang violence, or why LGBTQ youth are still more likely to commit suicide than their straight counterparts. If only he were able to see the clear messages he sends to everyone who is not a straight, white male and consider why they might then do the things they do.

text: Yyyeeesss, I had internalised misogyny about 3 years back, never did project it to anyone, it did block my chakras. It’s a form of self-harm that became a huge inner critic over time. I was an awaken change maker since I was 14, I always needed a greater purpose to motivate me, something I can conquer then share with the world. Maya Angelou’s quote inspired me then and now I hope it inspires you too. One clear sign of internalised misogyny is if a woman says the same thing as a man, including one in a dress, who comes across more credible to you? text:
I love #art in its infinite forms because of its ability to BAM, get to the heart & GUTS of TRUTH in such a raw, primal way that our words sometimes cannot. Especially when we use humor or absurdity, and in general, *extreme* expression to creatively drive our message home.
🔥
In working with #survivors of all kinds of horrific #abuse and deep #trauma, I encourage their expression of ALL their feelings, including those of violence and ANGER, especially for women, since we are conditioned by not only the #colonistculture but unfortunately, many other #sexist, #misogynist cultures, to repress and CONTROL & dismiss/ignore our anger and any other “negative” feelings we have. I say NO! Express it ALL!! Art is a safe, #healing & #cathartic way to get it OUT. Purge that shit that isn’t yours to carry, in whatever way(s) come easiest and most naturally to you. One delightful example of this is Italian-American #lesbian comic-creator Diane DiMassa who created the series “Hothead Paisan: Homicidal #Lesbian Terrorist.” Another example is some #indigenous artists right here on IG who make hilarious, uncomfortable & delightfully #seditious political #decolonizing memes which unsettle the #colonized/settler mindset. People such as @arnell.tf, @ijotikak @nicolerrabbit & @decolonial.meme.queens.
🔥
What kind of art, or which artists do you find inspiring & delightful in their creative expression of hard feelings? I invite you to share below, because this kind of stuff is not typically found in the mainstream. Much Peace, Power & Love to you mighty community! ☮✊💗
🔥
#CarrieBrownstein quote from this article 👇
.
https://www.thecut.com/2018/01/carrie-brownstein-on-metoo-and-the-end-of-portlandia.html
