text:
These quotes by the famous people regarding a woman’s place in society or at home makes a clear picture of their misogynistic mindset. This mental block is still rampant in our civilised societies. 
The persons having dual personalities with all regressive notions regarding fairer sex! 
The head of the family, the protector, guard, the bread earner, the one to whom a family look upto! What if, he is having a Jackell & Hyde personality? Publically, he is the nicest man to be around but at the core, he is a beast! His family especially females are petrified of him and he is a demon to live with. How will you spot such man?? They look same and don’t have any distinct features. But a keen observation may help you..
1. They can’t digest the fact, if a woman is more successful than them.
2. They may ask for sexual favors and ogle at women.
3. They may behave politely in public, but a monster in bed.
4. They find pleasure in beating women.
5. They love to pay bills for women, but can’t tolerate an independent woman.
6. They take women for granted and never cares for her feelings. 
Now, the problem is what if that person is father of two daughters, husband of a working wife. Imagine, the life of such family. The 3 ladies at home are not safe, since the protector is destroyer. The broken relationship, the aura of 24*7 stress, the uneasiness.. how do they deal with it? What parenting would that person do, who considers females as object only?
The women in the family is victim of his physical and mental abuses. But due to sheer society pressure, they feel its good and their duty to bear all this else their family will be judged as broken. “Log kya kahenge” aur betiyo ki shaadi kaise hogi..
And baap to baap hota hai! Until n unless this mentality is given up, such persons with dual personality will rule the roost and the talks of gender equality will remain on paper only. 
Secondly, to my readers
Crime is directly proportional to silence.
And IGNORANCE IS NOT A BLISS and if still you don’t feel anything its a sorry state of affair
#misogynist #respectwomen #genderequality #standupforyourself

text: To start this, I want to ask you if you support the new abortion laws. If you do, I really want to you unfollow me after reading this bc I don’t tolerate that on my account. Byeee! Quality before quantity, am I right? Soo, this law is one of the most disgusting, misogynistic laws and I can’t believe HOW this is our reality. If the baby comes out black, well not male, not straight, poor, from a family that’s not clean or stereotypical (the list continues...) you don’t give a flying fuck about them. You lock them up in fricking cages like they’re pigs, you cut their food stamps, you literally gas them, you bully them, you take away their rights. You risk their lives over and over again for not banning those goddamn guns of yours. Kids DIE because you, gop. A fetus DOES NOT EQUAL a kid and banning abortion will only make women reach for unsafe ways. Sticking spices or hangers up their vagina, overexercising to the point your body can’t handle a pregnancy. Don’t even get me started on criminalizing miscarriages or banning abortions for rape of incest victims. I want to vomit. You don’t care about any lives, you just want one other way to control women. If you would wake up one day and your gardener randomly had planted a tree in your garden, you wouldn’t blame the dirt for growing it, right? Forcing an 11 year old girl to give birth to her rapists baby is cruel. Forcing anyone to become a parent is cruel. Making kids grow up not wanted or not really loved is cruel. Saying “jusT Put ThEm Up fOR ADopTioN” is so disgusting, almost half a million kids are in foster care just in the US. And don’t come here talking about the Bible: tattoos, bacon, gossiping, wearing polyester is also against the Bible so you probably sin quite often! You aren’t an angel for forcing someone to be pregnant, go into labor and live life as a parent and if there is a god up there I doubt he would be proud of you for screaming “murder” in rape victims faces. PS!!! Not only women can get pregnant!!!

text:
I’m finally getting around to my response to @anukathiresanmd  campaign #drnotmrs .⁣
⁣
I’ve read responses from women physicians who are not married yet, those who are about to be married, and some like me who’ve been both for a very long time 😳.⁣
⁣
I’ve been Mrs Khan - ⁣
June 11,1988 👉🏽31 years ⁣
⁣
I’ve been Dr Khan -⁣
May 14,1992 👉🏽27 years ⁣
⁣
I’ve chosen a sub sub specialty that has very few women. ⁣
⁣
I’ve been demeaned, belittled, passed over and insulted so many times in 27 years that I a have developed a thick skin.⁣
⁣
Calling me Mrs Khan is like throwing a pebble at me - it barely registers any more.⁣
⁣
I’ve had huge boulders thrown at me and survived. ⁣
- Bitch⁣
-micro manager ⁣
-perfectionist ⁣
- hormonal ⁣
⁣
It only hurts me now when it comes from a male colleague that I thought respected me .⁣
⁣
A few months ago, a male MD told me that people had noticed my hair sticking out of my bonnet and implied I was stressed out and hormonal.⁣
⁣
This week an older male MD texted me to “ take a tranquilizer “ when I texted that he call me at his leisure to discuss a mutual patient.⁣ In all the years I’ve known and worked with him, I thought I had earned his respect. That 😞 hurt .
⁣
You can call me Mrs Khan ⁣
You can call me Hafiza ⁣
You can call me hey you ⁣
⁣
I don’t give a d..m⁣
⁣
I’ve been doing this a long time.  I am at the 17 mile mark in this 26 mile marathon and the finish line is in sight. ⁣

So #drnotmrs, I don’t care, because in the horizon for me is  just plain Hafiza.

text:
Ja, ich bin eine mündige Athletin. Ich war nicht immer eine Person, die sagt, wenn ihr etwas nicht passt. Aber das hat sich mit vielen Erfahrungen geändert. Und jetzt ist das eine Eigenschaft, an der besonders Männer zu nagen haben. Vorallem ältere, in Positionen in denen sie denken sie könnten dich bevormunden.

Ich habe von den verschiedensten Frauen in vielen Bereichen mitbekommen, wie so eine Gegenreaktion aussah: ob passive Aggressivität, hinterhältige Schachzüge oder sogar Choleriker. 
Und jedesmal kommt eine Wut in mir auf, die ich selbst wieder einzudämmen habe. Denn sie sind alle auch nur Opfer der gesellschaftlichen Konditionierung bestehend aus Sexismus, Rollenverteilung und Misogynie. 
TROTZDEM müssen wir dagegen angehen. Stark sein für die Mädchen, die nach uns kommen, damit sie es leichter haben. 
Deshalb mach ich mein Ding und ihr alle da draussen solltet es auch machen. 
#nichtaufgeben #wehrteuch #its2019 .

text:
#nowthispolitics - 
Meet the 25 white, #Republican men who decided to pass the strictest abortion ban in #Alabama 🤨 You get this is a movement right? .
You know that Roe v. Wade will be next right? .
.

That decision of the U.S. Supreme Court in which the Court ruled that the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution provides a fundamental "right to privacy" that protects a pregnant woman's liberty to choose whether or not to have an abortion, while also ruling that this right is not absolute and must be balanced against the government's interests in protecting women's health and protecting prenatal life.
.
The Court resolved this balancing test by tying state regulation of abortion to the three trimesters of pregnancy: the Court ruled that during the first trimester, governments could not prohibit abortions; during the second trimester, abortions still could not be prohibited, but governments could "regulate the abortion procedure in ways that are reasonably related to maternal health"; during the third trimester, abortions could be prohibited entirely so long as the laws contained exceptions for cases when abortion was necessary to save the life of the mother. .
Because the Court classified the right to choose to have an abortion as "fundamental", the decision required courts to evaluate challenged abortion laws under the "strict scrutiny" standard, the highest level of judicial review in the United States.
.

text:
#ReligiousAbuse: Abusers often find victims in religious circles. Reasons include teachings on forgiveness, shame surrounding divorce, And this part is important: Too many lessons on what a woman’s role should be, & how they should act & behave compared to men.
. 
Listed on the official abuse website: Roomtobesafe.org, a red flag in a relationship is “noticing your partner has very traditional (or stereotypical) beliefs about gender roles.”
.
Below is a quote taught to me by well-meaning Sunday school teachers & loved by many women I personally know. But guess what? I hate it. “The world has enough women who are tough; we need women who are tender. There are enough women who are coarse; we need women who are kind. There are enough women who are rude; we need women who are refined. We have enough women of fame and fortune; we need more women of faith. We have enough greed; we need more goodness. We have enough vanity; we need more virtue. We have enough popularity; we need more purity.”
.
My rewording: ”The world has enough women who don’t realize you can be both tough and tender; we need more women to believe in their strength. We have enough women who feel they should put pleasing others before themselves, we need more women willing to speak their truth. There are enough women who feel they can’t stand up for themselves because that would be rude and unrefined; we need more women who know they can take a stand and refuse to tolerate bad behavior. We don’t have enough women of fame and fortune; we need more women (including women of faith) to not be ashamed of success or taking control of their finances. We have enough greed, we need more willing females to lead humanity. We have enough vanity; we need more women to stand up to those who believe women are only objects to be admired. We have enough popularity; we need more females driven by their true passions and supported for being authentic, rather than being judged while sitting in the pews.”
.
I feel better. Now that is a quote I can get behind. 👊🏼 #lightlovelauren

He says something else gross about my climbing skills, I say “that’s gross, and unless you want this to be a really uncomfortable flight, you need to apologize”, he says “I won’t”, I turn to the guy behind me in line and say “would you like this seat next to this misogynistic piece of shit, it’s got some good legroom “ and turn to exit the row. Of course, now he’s not getting up and letting me out now, so, as trapped as one can be on a boarding plane, I say “unless you want my knee in your balls, you need to get up and let me the fuck out”, and press the call button to get some sort of backup since bystanders do nothing. text:
I once knew a Women who would always keep smiling, even during dark Times and I wondered how she used to do it and still today I don't know from where she used to muster the courage to do so.

I knew her very well
I loved her.
I came from within her.

She always used to quote Virginia wolf, and one of her sayings has always been stuck in my head.
"I am rooted but I flow." I can't begin to explain how intriguing it is.
The whole idea of that single goddamn sentence is just so overwhelming.

I have learnt a lot from the women in my life.
Who have been of help at times  I couldn't even get myself to do anything.
And I thank them,
I thank them For helping me grow, for nourishing me and for Shaping me into the person I am myself today. ● In Frame :- @a_shettyx
